excerpt.rendered: As stock markets, at least in the US and Europe, climb to new highs, investors have become nervous that a correction might lie ahead. After all, the S&P index in the US is on track for its seventh straight monthly advance, the longest winning streak since January 2018. The US stock market has also rebounded by more than 100% from its March 2020 lows; this represents one of the strongest one-year gains since World War II.
